meanings.definition: To surpass in echoing or reverberating.
meanings.sent1: The canyon's walls outechoing the sound of the rushing river.
meanings.sent2: Her laughter outechoing through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse thought it was outechoing the lion's roar.
meanings.sent4: The cheers of the crowd outechoing the noise of the passing train.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outechoing the church bells in the distance.

meanings.definition: To resound or reverberate louder than something else.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks outechoing the distant thunder.
meanings.sent2: His voice outechoing across the vast valley.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bell on the cat's collar seemed to be outechoing the church bell.
meanings.sent4: The drumbeats outechoing the rhythm of the heart.
meanings.sent5: The howl of the wolf outechoing through the silent forest.
